data.title: Pretty good first visit
data.text: Great medieval themed tavern. The bar staff was very friendly and the NFL specials are very decent.  I'd put this place on the to-visit bar-hop list if you are in Old Towne Alexandria

data.title: Fun Spot, $$$ Beer
data.text: Our bar tender was superb. He let us try out beers we liked until we found one. Great experience and worth the stop. The negative was the price for a Stella was $6 and that seems a bit high. Overall fun, just would love a cheaper list.

data.title: Good for one visit
data.text: Interesting place. Went for dinner. Like an old world tavern, nothing fancy.  Food was above average; meat was great. Husband had prime rib (yummo) and I had steak with mushrooms, onions and Bleu cheese. Sides (potatoes and asparagus) and desserts were so-so.  Overall not a bad place to eat, but kind of a one and done place.

data.title: Delicious beer, food and wonderful conversation !
data.text: This conversation starting Renaissance tavern in Alexandria is not to be missed! The food is tasty, the beer unique, and the ambiance a delightful moment to ponder the most dynamic time in history past  with enchanting conversation. -Not to mention the fact that this tavern is owned by our veterans in a cooperative venture that is committed to employing vets.  We had the fish and chips (I love sweet potato chips which they had) and basted ribs with tasty red skin mashed potatoes- both were delicious and accompanied by well suited lagers. Great atmosphere for a date or even children. We hope to return for the prime rib brunch for only $16! Enjoy!

data.title: Tuesday night echo
data.text:
Stopped in for a drink on a Tuesday night and the place was so empty you could here an echo when you spoke. 

Even for old town the drink prices were expensive.  I thought it was sad as we left we saw advertised specials are server neglected to tell us about. 

Won't be going back anytime soon.

data.title: Nice place for dinner!
data.text: Varied menu, reasonable prices, good food, good service.  There are many good restaurants in Old Town but we liked this one best.  The menu says it's owned by veterans.

data.title: Huge variety of food for Sunday brunch
data.text: Atmosphere is British pub.  Delicious food, reasonably priced, especially for what is available to you.  The all-you-can-eat buffet, includes the usual breakfast foods as well as prime rib, roast beef, ham, salad, different breads, etc.  A chef makes quiche  from fresh ingredients as you stand in front of him and choose.  The regular menu includes a blend of ancient and modern cuisines.  There is a "Medieval feast" which includes a period costumed actors.  They have live music Wednesday & Saturday nights.  A great place.

data.title: Great place to eat!
data.text:
I race to tripadvisor when I find a great place - 
Jon Strongbow's Tavern is a *great* place to eat - 
I highly recommend it!
My wife had the Medieval salad, potatoes with cheese and sautéed vegetables; while I ate meatloaf with marinara sauce, sautéed vegetables and rice -
both absolutely delicious!
World class selection of beers! Enjoy! You can't go wrong.

data.title: Very nice meal and a fun bar
data.text: We had lunch here.  Very cool place.  The food was very good.   Met some nice people in the bar who gave us various recommendations for sightseeing, etc

data.title: Best Sunday Brunch in Town
data.text: My wife and friends have gone to eat here several times.  It is a very magical place.  Great atmosphere and service. Yes they have the Medieval Madness show, but we came for the Sunday brunch.  It is a buffet with carving stations and great food for a great price.  The bar is also open and serves various adult beverages and a great selection of craft beers.  To me, this Sunday brunch offers the best food at a great price nd IS THE BEST in Ole Town.  Cheers!

data.title: Schizophrenic
data.text: by which I refer to the conversational meaning of the word: split personality.  The split is between the kitchen and the customer experience.  The kitchen is excellent.  Our sample was small because my wife and I had the same thing--chopped salad and shepard's pie.  Both were outstanding, truly superior.  But the customer experience?  Ugh!  Start with the hard wooden chairs with no cushions.  Not just hard but FLAT, with no molded shape to fit your bottom.  There was only one single table where the chairs had cushions and had that table not been available we would not have stayed.  Then there was the dim dim dim lighting, which we had to ask them to brighten so that our baby boomer eyes could read the menu.  Then they have no non-alcoholic beer available..  How hard is it to stock one brand of non-alcoholic beer?  Then thy delivered the salad after they delivered the shepard's pie.  Then there was the untrained 18 year old server who was baffled when I asked for a Dewars on the rocks and who removed my wife's water from the table while there was still food on her plate.  We arrived at 7:30 on a Thursday evening and the place with mostly empty.  Given those chairs I am not surprised.  What a waste of a great kitchen.

data.title: Nothing special
data.text: Food was mediocre at best. Pot roast was dry.  Service was poor. Bartender inattentive and acted like he didnt want to be there.  Hard to get a drink and we were the only ones at the bar.  Was a Sunday afternoon.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Medieval themed restaurant that we visited on a weeknight. We were the only ones there.  Both of us had the schnitzel, which was good.  Every night we went past the place appeared empty.   Don't know why, it was a good place to eat!

data.title: Enjoyed food and visit
data.text: Stopped in for late night dinner and drink.  Enjoyed live music, extensive wine and beer options, food was excellent.  Good Value.  Would recommend to all.  Would definitely return.

data.title: Awesome old wines n beers
data.text: Check dis place out.  Tons of centuries old recipes and they're passionate about their wares.  I ain't lying my brotha. Noahmsayin??

data.title: Very poor value
data.text: Had lunch shepherds pie, terrible tasted like taco meat looked like taco meat. Maple ham and cheddar biscuit appetizer 7.50 for 2 -1.5 inch diameter biscuits. Service just ok and place was dead.

data.title: Enjoyable lunch
data.text: We had a late lunch here, to warm up and get out of the rain.  Our waiter was very personable and helpful, the decor was interesting to look at, and the history on the back of the menu was worth the read! . Both of us had the "medieval cocktails".... the Dragon's Kiss did a great job of warming the core.   The Shepherd's pie was especially enjoyable, with a great meaty flavor, and both dishes were served piping hot.   If we had the time, we would have come back later for the entertainment, and will try to visit again if we have the chance.

data.title: Mead..say it again...Mead
data.text: My wife and I decided to stop in for a quick drink and an appetizer.What we found was some of the best appetizers and drinks we have EVER had. We had one of the mead's (honey wine) with crusted brie with apples and a honey drizzle. Let's just say we were glad we stopped in and will be going back. The atmosphere is fantastic! Sort of a medieval tavern with all kinds of treats that you are not expecting. Have an adventure and go to this place if you are in Alexandria!

data.title: Another good find
data.text: Another called in off the street. Nice nice folks here. Steak was wonderful, good beer menu. Has a smoking lounge upstairs and you would never know it. I was very surprised when I found out. Met one of the owner and he truly cared about quality. Even better they have a Veteran discount. If in old town give them a chance. Really cool old building to boot.

data.title: Gluhwein!!!
data.text: This is a military friendly bar/restaurant. We just stopped in for drinks, but were pleasantly surprised. For whatever reason, it was pretty empty, but not disturbingly so.  I've read previous critiques of the single guitarist's performance...but I enjoyed it, and didn't mind that it didn't match the "medieval" theme (perhaps having had a few beers prior to my arrival lowered my expectations, but I prefer to believe that as a Gen Xer, I like a broad range of music). Anyway, I was psyched by the fact that they had legit German gluhwein from Augsburg! Best possible beverage after a cold walk up from the water front! The bartender was awesome...super friendly and attentive. If you're military interested in Special Forces, check out the upstairs. Didn't eat, so can't assess the food. Hope this place survives!
